titlestmt.titleproper: Arthur J. Cain manuscripts on C. S. Rafinesque 1988-1990
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Arthur J. Cain manuscripts on C. S. Rafinesque

bioghist.p: Arthur J. Cain (1921-1999) was an evolutionary biologist whose research interests include genetics, natural selection, biogeography, and systematics. A professor at Oxford University and, later, the University of Liverpool, much of Cain's research was been field-based, focusing on terrestrial gatsropods. Constantine Samuel Rafinesque (1783-1840) was a professor of botany, natural history and modern languages at Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky from 1818 to 1826. He published on a wide variety of topics, including botany, ichthyology, economics, and the Bible.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of multiple typescript drafts of a manuscript of Constantine Samuel Rafinesque Schmaltz on Classification; a Translation of Early Works (Tryonia #20), translated and introduced by Arthur J. Cain. Several of the drafts carry annotations by reviewers and copyeditors.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Transferred by George Davis, Malacology Department
